page.title: 02RURAL NEEDS:BAD'HAM/DENN'TON
page.content: In joint first place of improvements people would like to see to village life came more & more varied shopping facilities & delivery services, and housing. Provision of cheaper homes for local people, first time buyers, the elderly & to rent had high priority. Fewer holiday homes & USAF, & stricter planning control were also mentioned.Badingham wanted a playing field, a regular bus service, street lighting & speed limit. Better public transport, a bypass, Youth Club & parking for school cars were suggested for Dennington. Main drainage, more & better kept footpaths, better hedge & verge cutting, a community care scheme, more community leisure activities, rural industries & more young families were referred to more than once. However, many people felt that no improvements were needed.
